pageTitle: Itinerary for Tuesday, May 29, 2018 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

7:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Cabinet meeting.

Note for media:

    • Ministers will be available to media in the House of Commons Foyer as of 10 a.m.

Toronto, Ontario

3:30 p.m.     The Prime Minister will be interviewed by Bloombergâ€™s Senior Executive Editor for Economics, Stephanie Flanders, to discuss economic growth and gender equality ahead of the G7 Summit. This will be part of Bloomberg Businessweek Debrief series. 

Omni King Edward Hotel, Vanity Fair Ballroom (2nd Floor)
37 King Street East         

Notes for media:

    • Open coverage for reporters only (pooled still camera, no video cameras)
    • Media should arrive no later than 3 p.m. and RSVP in advance to kchyka@bloomberg.net
    • The pool feed will be available on port BLM1 on the NY Switch. 1080/60i, HD-SDI.
    • Video is embargoed for use until 4:30 p.m. (Bloomberg must be credited). For any questions, call Bloomberg Transmissions at 212-617-5066.
    • Portions of the interview will begin airing live at 3:30 p.m. on Bloomberg Television and online at https://www.bloomberg.com/live/us
    • Photos will be available at https://mediasource.bloomberg.com/

5:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will deliver closing remarks at the Canadian Transformational Infrastructure Summit and the CanInfra Challenge.

The Globe and Mail Centre, Event Space (17th Floor)
351 King Street East

Notes for media:

    • Open coverage
    • Media are asked to arrive no later than 4:45 p.m. at the Nahanni room 1651 (16th floor)

6:15 p.m. The Prime Minister and the Minister of Finance, Bill Morneau, will participate in a roundtable discussion with business leaders.

The Globe and Mail Centre, Fundy Room (16th floor)
351 King Street East

Notes for media:

    • Photo opportunity at the beginning of the roundtable
    • Media are asked to arrive no later than 4:45 p.m. at the Nahanni room 1651 (16th floor)
